title: Ipopt build error with Linux Clang
body:
I'm now on an Ubuntu machine working with Clang. After implementing the compiler wrapper fix proposed in #3903, Ipopt still did not compile but showed the error 
`"don't have function for random number generator"`. 

A search revealed that this error comes from the Linux version of Clang (see [here](https://github.com/JuliaOpt/Ipopt.jl/issues/13) and scroll to the end). The suggestion there is to add `coin_skip_warn_cxxflags=yes` to the configure call.

 In file
https://github.com/LLNL/spack/blob/develop/var/spack/repos/builtin/packages/ipopt/package.py
you see the following section:
```
configure_args = [
  "--prefix=%s" % prefix,
  "--with-mumps-incdir=%s" % mumps_dir.include,
  "--with-mumps-lib=%s" % mumps_libcmd,
  "--enable-shared",
  "--with-blas-incdir=%s" % blas_dir.include,
  "--with-blas-lib=%s" % blas_lib,
  "--with-lapack-incdir=%s" % lapack_dir.include,
  "--with-lapack-lib=%s" % lapack_lib
  ]
```

If this section is extended to account for the additional flag as
```
configure_args = [
  "--prefix=%s" % prefix,
  "--with-mumps-incdir=%s" % mumps_dir.include,
  "--with-mumps-lib=%s" % mumps_libcmd,
  "--enable-shared",
  "coin_skip_warn_cxxflags=yes",
  "--with-blas-incdir=%s" % blas_dir.include,
  "--with-blas-lib=%s" % blas_lib,
  "--with-lapack-incdir=%s" % lapack_dir.include,
  "--with-lapack-lib=%s" % lapack_lib
  ]
```
then the build works fine for me. Note that this additional flag does not have the preceding '--'.
